description.narrative: At least 90% of birth delivery (Health facility) sites and the linked feeder (PHC) clinics in selected districts provide and monitor a package for improving newborn and under five child health outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At least 90% of birth delivery (Health facility) sites and the linked feeder (PHC) clinics in selected districts provide and monitor a package for improving newborn and under five child health outcomes

description.narrative: Although South Africa regained its polio free status in September 2019, which was lost in late 2018, DPT3 coverage declined from 84 per cent in 2017 to 82 per cent in 2018. To improve coverage of immunization and other essential MNCH services, the country with UNICEF support prioritized strengthening routine immunization and the overall vaccine preventable diseases (VPD) surveillance system and rolling out of the essential MNCH (Mother-Baby) package for the First 1,000 Days to ensure all pregnant women and mothers with children below two years receive all the essential life-saving services at every visit to the health facilities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2020

title.narrative: Effective vaccine management (EVM) composite country score
Percentage of targeted mothers reached through continuous social mobilization and communication to promote immunization
Existence of a Multi-Year Plan (MYP) for immunisation
Availability of functional newborn care technical working group
